intro: Pedicularis abrotanifolia var. altaica, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its erect stem and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes where conditions are harsh. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This species is of interest to botanists due to its adaptation to extreme environments and its role in alpine ecosystems.
